Full case title: Jan Oostergetel and Theodora Laurentius v. The Slovak Republic
Sector: Manufacture of textiles
Summary: Claims arising out of alleged actions and omissions by the Slovak authorities that resulted in BCT's bankruptcy, including actions taken by a Bratislava court and the local tax office.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 30 April 2010;Final Award dated 23 April 2012

Full case title: Achmea B.V. v. The Slovak Republic (PCA Case No. 2013-12) (II)
Sector: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's announced plan to establish a unitary public health insurance system in Slovakia run by the State, which would allegedly entail the expropriation of Achmea’s stake in a Slovak health insurance company.
Decisions: Award on Jurisdiction and Admissibility dated 20 May 2014

Full case title: The Rompetrol Group N.V. v. Romania (ICSID Case No. ARB/06/3)
Sector: Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products
Summary: Claims arising out of investigations undertaken by Romanian anti-corruption and criminal prosecution authorities relating to the privatisation of an oil refinery company, shortly after the sale of the controlling shares to the claimant, allegedly including the arrest, detention, travel-ban and wire-tapping of key company's executives.
Decisions: Decision on Respondent’s Preliminary Objections on Jurisdiction and Admissibility dated 18 April 2008; Award dated 6 May 2013
Award: Awarded in favor of neither investor nor state

Full case title: Alapli Elektrik B.V. v. Turkey (ICSID Case No. ARB/08/13)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of a concession to develop, finance, construct, own, operate and transfer a combined cycle power plant in Turkey and a number of legislative changes in 2000 concerning infrastructure projects in Turkey.
Decisions: Award dated 16 July 2012

Full case title: Liman Caspian Oil BV and NCL Dutch Investment BV v. Kazakhstan (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/14)
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Summary: Claims arising out of the transfer of claimants' license to explore and extract hydrocarbons in the Liman block in Western Kazakhstan.
Decisions: Award dated 22 June 2010

Full case title: Azpetrol International Holdings B.V., Azpetrol Group B.V. and Azpetrol Oil Services Group B.V. v. Azerbaijan (ICSID Case No. ARB/06/15)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply; Land transport and transport via pipelines; Warehousing and support activities for transportation
Summary: Claims arising out of Azpetrol International Holdings’s loss of its shares in Azpetrol Group and Azpetrol Oil Services Group, after an Azerbaijan court decided the original purchase contract had been ineffective, and returned the shares to their former owner.
Decisions: Award dated 8 September 2009

Full case title: USA Steel Global Holdings I B.V. v. The Slovak Republic (PCA Case No. 2013-6)
Sector: Manufacture of basic metals
Summary: Claims arising out of the imposition of certain electricity tariffs upon claimant's local steel plant, US Steel Košice.
Decisions: Not applicable

Full case title: Invesmart v. Czech Republic
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged withdrawal by the Czech previous commitments to provide State support to the foreign-owned bank.
Decisions: Award dated 3 July 2009

Full case title: Tulip Real Estate Investment and Development Netherlands B.V. v. Turkey (ICSID Case No. ARB/11/28)
Sector: Real estate activities
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged Government's termination of a mixed-use residential and commercial real estate development project in Istanbul, known as Ispartakule III, in which the claimant held interests.
Decisions: Decision on Bifurcated Jurisdictional Issue dated 5 March 2013;Award dated 10 March 2014
Concurring opinion issued: Separate Opinion of Michael Evan Jaffe on the Question of Attribution Under Art 8, ILC Articles (Award)

Full case title: Highbury International AVV and Ramstein Trading Inc. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/11/1)
Sector: Mining of metal ores
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's alleged coercive taking of the areas where claimants held mining concessions within the region of the Lower Caroní River without payment of compensation.
Decisions: Award dated 26 September 2013

Full case title: AES Corporation and Tau Power B.V. v. Kazakhstan (ICSID Case No. ARB/10/16)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of a series of actions including fines and tariff restrictions imposed to claimants by Kazakh competition authorities concerning energy prices that allegedly had adverse financial impacts on the company’s operations in the country.
Decisions: Award dated 1 November 2013
Award: Awarded in favor of neither investor nor state

Full case title: HICEE B.V. v. The Slovak Republic (PCA Case No. 2009-11)
Sector: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's adoption of a number of changes and amendments to the laws on health insurance since 2007, including an Act by which health insurance companies were prohibited from distributing profits and made subject to a cap on their permissible administrative expenses.
Decisions: Partial Award dated 23 May 2011;Supplementary and Final Award dated 17 October 2011
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Judge Charles N. Brower (Partial Award)

Full case title: KT Asia Investment Group B.V. v. Kazakhstan (ICSID Case No. ARB/09/8)
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's alleged forced nationalization of claimant's interest in BTA Bank, by means of Kazakhstan's acquisition of around 75 per cent of the shares of BTA through the National Welfare Fund SamrUnited Kingdom-Kazyna.
Decisions: Award dated October 17, 2013

Full case title: Saba Fakes v. Turkey (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/20)
Sector: Telecommunications
Summary: Claims arising out of the receivership and the alleged subsequent forced sale by Turkish authorities of assets held by Telsim, a major mobile phone company in which the claimant had invested.
Decisions: Decision on Preliminary Issues dated 6 October 2008;Award dated 14 July 2010

Full case title: Aguas del Tunari S.A. v. Bolivia (ICSID Case No. ARB/02/3)
Sector: Water collection, treatment and supply; Sewerage
Summary: Claims arising out of alleged actions and omissions of the government leading up to the rescission of a concession agreement entered into with the claimant.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 21 October 2005; Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Tribunal dated 28 March 2006, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 44
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Declaration of Jose Luis Alberro-Semerena (Decision on Jurisdiction)

Full case title: TSA Spectrum de Argentina S.A. v. Argentine Republic (ICSID Case No. ARB/05/5)
Sector: Telecommunications
Summary: Claims arising out of the termination of the concession contract entered into with the claimant through a resolution deciding that the national's telecommunications authority would operate the installations and assets that were the object of the contract due to the investor's alleged illicit enrichment.
Decisions: Award dated19 December 2008
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Arbitrator Grant D. Aldonas (Award); Concurring Opinion of Arbitrator Georges Abi-Saab (Award)

Full case title: Slovak Gas Holding BV, GDF International SAS and E.ON Ruhrgas International GmbH v. Slovak Republic (ICSID Case No. ARB/12/7)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of legislative amendments affecting Slovakian price regulation in the gas sector that were allegedly in contravention of certain shareholder's agreement concluded between the claimants and Slovakia, among other actions allegedly resulting in financial losses for claimants' investment in a Slovakian gas company.
Decisions: Award embodying the parties' settlement agreement dated 19 March 2013

Full case title: Emmis International Holding, B.V., Emmis Radio Operating, B.V., MEM Magyar Electronic Media Kereskedelmi és Szolgáltató Kft. v. Hungary (ICSID Case No. ARB/12/2)
Sector: Programming and broadcasting activities
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged expropriation of claimants' investments in nationwide FM-frequency radio-broadcasting licenses in Hungary, through the Government's decision to award the radio-broadcasting frequencies formerly held by claimants to a third party.
Decisions: Decision on Respondent’s Objection Under ICSID Arbitration Rule 41(5) dated 11 March 2013; Decision on Respondent's Application for Bifurcation dated 13 June 2013; Award dated 16 April 2014

Full case title: FEDAX N.V. v. The Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/96/3)
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged lack of payment of certain debt instruments issued by the Government which were assigned by way of endorsement to the claimant.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 11 July 1997;Award dated 9 March 1998

Full case title: Bernardus Henricus Funnekotter and others v. Zimbabwe (ICSID Case No. ARB/05/6)
Sector: Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities
Summary: Claims arising out of the enactment of a Land Acquisition Act and other measures authorizing the Government to acquire compulsorily any rural land when the acquisition was deemed necessary for agricultural settlement purposes under which the claimants' properties were allegedly expropriated without compensation, including the presence of war veterans and settlers that forced the claimants to vacate their farms.
Decisions: Award dated 22 April 2009

Full case title: Bureau Veritas, Inspection, Valuation, Assesment and Control, BIVAC B.V. v. Paraguay (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/9)
Sector: Other professional, scientific and technical activities
Summary: Claims arising out of Paraguay's alleged non-payment of invoices to the investor under a contract in which Bureau Veritas was to provide pre-shipment inspection support to the Paraguayan Customs Agency, to assist the collection of import duties.
Decisions: Decision of the Tribunal on Objections to Jurisdiction dated 29 May 2009;Further Decision on Objections to Jurisdiction dated 9 October 2012;Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Tribunal dated 7 August 2014, pursuant to Arbitration Rule 43(1)

Full case title: Achmea B.V. (formerly Eureko B.V.) v. The Slovak Republic (PCA Case No. 2008-13) (I)
Sector: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Summary: Claims arising out of various legislative measures introduced by Slovakia that allegedly constituted a systematic reversal of the previous liberalisation of the Slovak health insurance market that had prompted the claimant to invest in the Slovak Republic’s health insurance sector.
Decisions: Award on Jurisdiction, Arbitrability and Suspension dated 26 October 2010;Award dated 7 December 2012

Full case title: Eastern Sugar B.V. v. The Czech Republic (SCC Case No. 088/2004)
Sector: Manufacture of food products
Summary: Claims arising out of various regulatory sugar regimes put in place by the respondent from 2000 onwards; particularly, the Czech Republic’s allocation of sugar quotas based on the European Union’s agricultural quota system that allegedly affected the claimant's investments.
Decisions: Partial Award dated 27 March 2007;Final Award dated 12 April 2007
Concurring opinion issued: Partial Dissenting Opinion of Robert Volterra (Final Award)

Full case title: E.T.I. Euro Telecom International N.V. v. Plurinational State of Bolivia (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/28) (I)
Sector: Telecommunications
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's transfer of claimant's 50 per cent stake in the Bolivian telecoms company Entel to the State after the company was nationalized in 2007.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance of the proceeding issued by the Tribunal dated 21 October 2009, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 44

Full case title: E.T.I. Euro Telecom International N.V. v. Bolivia (II)
Sector: Telecommunications
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's transfer of claimant's 50 per cent stake in the Bolivian telecoms company Entel to the State after the company was nationalized in 2007.
Decisions: Data not available

Full case title: Interbrew v. Slovenia (ICSID Case No. ARB/04/17)
Sector: Manufacture of beverages
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged role of the Slovenian Government concerning the acquisition of equity interests in the second largest local brewer Pivovarna Union.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Tribunal dated 18 July 2005, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 44

Full case title: Khan Resources Inc., Khan Resources B.V. and Cauc Holding Company Ltd. v. the Government of Mongolia and Monatom Co., Ltd.
Sector: Mining of metal ores
Summary: Claims arising out of Mongolia’s cancellation of claimant's mining and exploration licenses for a uranium deposit located in the Dornod province in northeastern Mongolia.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated July 2012;Award dated 2 March 2015

Full case title: Rail World LLC and others v. Estonia (ICSID Case No. ARB/06/6)
Sector: Civil engineering
Summary: Claims arising out of Estonia's renationalisation of its national railway, which allegedly reversed a planned privatisation and modified claimants' rail operations contract.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Tribunal dated 5 February 2007, pursuant to Arbitration Rule 43(1)

Full case title: CME Czech Republic B.V. v. The Czech Republic
Sector: Programming and broadcasting activities
Summary: Claims arising out of actions and omissions attributed to the Media Council, an organ of the Czech Republic that allegedly commercially destroyed the broadcasting station operator which was partly owned by the investor.
Decisions: Partial Award dated 13 September 2001;Final Award dated 14 March 2003
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting opinion of the Arbitrator JUDr Jaroslav Hándl (Partial Award);Separate Opinion on the issues at the quantum phases of CME v. Czech Republic by Ian Brownlie, C.B.E., Q.C. (Final Award)

Full case title: SalUnited Kingdoma Investments BV v. The Czech Republic
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the imposition of a forced administration upon the investor's banking enterprise by the Czech National Bank.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction over the Czech Republic's Counterclaim dated 7 May 2004;Partial Award dated 17 March 2006
Arbitrator2: Fortier, L. Y. (replacement); Price, D. M. (resigned)

Full case title: OI European Group B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/11/25)
Sector: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Summary: Claims arising out of disagreements between the parties over the amount of compensation owed by the Government for the nationalization of two expropriated glass manufacturing plants in which the claimant had invested.
Decisions: Award dated 10 March 2015

Full case title: CEMEX Caracas Investments B.V. and CEMEX Caracas II Investments B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/08/15)
Sector: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's 2008 nationalization of foreign-owned cement companies in Venezuela, including the claimants, and disagreements over the amount of compensation owed to CEMEX.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 30 December 2010;Order taking note of the discontinuance of the proceeding issued by the Tribunal dated 15 February 2012, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 43(1)

Full case title: Holcim Limited, Holderfin B.V. and Caricement B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/09/3)
Sector: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's 2008 nationalization of foreign-owned cement companies in Venezuela, including the claimants, and the alleged cease of compensation negotiations between Holcim and the national oil company PDVSA.
Decisions: Not applicable

Full case title: Eni Dación B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/4)
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Summary: Claims arising out the investor's refusal to sign an amended contract which would allegedly grant a majority stake in its oil venture to the Venezuelan State and the subsequent seizure of its assets and the Government's nationalization of the Dación oil field in which the claimant, a Dutch subsidiary of Italy's oil and gas company Eni Spa, had invested.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Acting Secretary-General dated 18 APril 2008, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 44

Full case title: Venezuela Holdings B.V. and others v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/27)
Home State of investor: Bahamas; United States of America; Netherlands
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Summary: Claims arising out of Venezuela's nationalization of two oil projects in which the claimants had interests known as the Cerro Negro Project and La Ceiba Project (after having increased their applicable royalty rate and income tax) and subsequent disagreements between the parties concerning the amount of compensation owed to the investor.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 10 June 2010;Award of the Tribunal dated 9 October 2014

Full case title: Eureko B.V. v. Poland
Sector: Insurance, reinsurance and pension funding, except compulsory social security
Summary: Claims arising out of the privatisation of a Polish insurance company and subsequent alleged actions by the Minister of the State Treasury of Poland which negatively affected the corporate governance of the company in which the claimants had invested.
Decisions: Partial Award dated 19 August 2005
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Mr. Jerzy Rajski (Partial Award)

Full case title: ABCI Investments Limited v. Tunisia (ICSID Case No. ARB/04/12)
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged takeover of claimant's controlling stake in a French-Tunisian bank by duress, including criminal proceedings against shareholders taken by the respondent following claimant's attempts to enforce an ICC award.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 18 February 2011
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Professor Brigitte Stern (Decision on Jurisdiction)

Full case title: K+ Venture Partners v. Czech Republic
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the termination of a contract concluded between the Dutch firm's Czech subsidiary and Czech authorities despite allegedly achieving the agreed results, and involving unpaid contractual premium for administration of certain public funds.
Decisions: Data not available

Full case title: Charanne B.V. and Construction Investments S.a.r.l. v. Spain
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of a series of energy reforms undertaken by the Government affecting the renewables sector, including a 7 per cent tax on power generators’ revenues and a reduction in subsidies for renewable energy producers.
Decisions: Pending

Full case title: ABN Amro N.V. v. India
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of respondent's alleged failure to protect the investor's loans in the Dabhol combined cycle power plant project in India, the default of which resulted in significant losses to the claimant's financing of the failed project.
Decisions: Data not available

Full case title: Itera International Energy LLC and Itera Group NV v. Georgia (ICSID Case No. ARB/08/7)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged restructuring of significant gas debts owed by Georgian state-owned entities to Itera and actions subsequently taken by Georgia that rendered the claimants’ investments valueless, including the bankruptcy proceedings of a chemical fertilizer plant in the city of Rustavi in which Itera had acquired a majority shareholding.
Decisions: Decision on the Admissibility of Ancillary Claims dated 4 December 2009;Order taking note of the discontinuance of the proceeding issued by the Tribunal dated 19 November 2010, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 43(1)
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Professor Francisco Orrego Vicuña (Decision on the Admissibility of Ancillary Claims)

Full case title: MNSS B.V. and Recupero Credito Acciaio N.V v. Montenegro (ICSID Case No. ARB(AF)/12/8)
Sector: Manufacture of basic metals
Summary: Claims arising out of alleged Government interference with the operation and management of a steel production facility in which the claimants had invested, leading to its bankruptcy.
Decisions: Pending

Full case title: Trinh Vinh Binh and Binh Chau Joint Stock Company v. Socialist Vietnam
Sector: Manufacture of food products; Real estate activities
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged unlawful confiscation of real estate and other claimants' assets without compensation, including the criminal conviction of Mr. Trinh.
Decisions: Award dated 14 March 2007

Full case title: I&I Beheer B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/05/4)
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged non-payment of two promissory notes acquired by the claimant that had been originally issued in 1981 by Venezuela's State-owned agricultural development bank, Bandagro.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Tribunal dated 28 December 2007, pursuant to Article 44 of the ICSID Convention

Full case title: Lao Holdings N.V. v. Lao People’s Democratic Republic (ICSID Case No. ARB(AF)/12/6)
Sector: Accommodation; Gambling and betting activities
Summary: Claims arising out of alleged material breaches of a settlement agreement aimed at putting an end to the ICSID AF arbitration between the parties concerning Lao Holdings’ investments in gambling and tourism facilities in Laos (including the construction and operation of two hotels and casinos, and three slot-machine clubs), after the Government allegedly authorized the building of a competitor's casino in the same province.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 21 February 2014; Settlement Agreement dated 15 June 2014;Interim Ruling on Issues Arising Under the Deed of Settlement dated 19 December 2014

Full case title: Mittal Steel Company N.V. v. Czech Republic
Sector: Manufacture of basic metals
Summary: Claims arising out of the respondent's alleged discriminatory treatment to the investor in connection with the privatization of the local steel enterprise Vitkovice Steel; particularly, the exclusion of the claimant from bidding on Vitkovice.
Decisions: Data not available

Full case title: Shell Nigeria Ultra Deep Limited v. Federal Nigeria (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/18)
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged breach of a production-sharing contract concluded between Shell Nigeria and Nigeria's state oil company (NNPC), after the State ordered NNPC's portion of the venture to be handed over to a private company, Malabu Oil and Gas, with which the claimant had farmed the relevant exploration block.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance of the proceeding issued by the Tribunal dated 1 August 2011, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 43(1)

Full case title: Offshore Power Production C.V., Travamark Two B.V., EFS India-Energy B.V., Enron B.V., and Indian Power Investments B.V. v. India
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of respondent alleged failure to protect claimants' investment in the Dabhol power plant project in India, which resulted in significant losses to the claimants' financing of the failed project.
Decisions: Data not available

Full case title: ConocoPhillips Petrozuata B.V., ConocoPhillips Hamaca B.V. and ConocoPhillips Gulf of Paria B.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/07/30)
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas
Summary: Claims arising out of Venezuela's nationalization of three oil projects in which the claimants had interests, after having increased their applicable royalty rate and income tax.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction and Merits dated 3 September 2013; Decision on Respondent's Request for Reconsideration dated 10 March 2014
Concurring opinion issued: Dissenting Opinion of Georges Abi-Saab (Decision on the Proposal to Disqualify a Majority of the Tribunal)

Full case title: Longreef Investments A.V.V. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/11/5)
Sector: Manufacture of food products
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's nationalization of Compañia Anónima Café Fama de América, a 120-year old coffee company in which the claimant had invested.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction dated 12 February 2014

Full case title: Guardian Fiduciary Trust, Ltd, f/k/a Capital Conservator Savings & Loan, Ltd v. Macedonia, former Yugoslav (ICSID Case No. ARB/12/31)
Respondent State: Macedonia, The former Yugoslav Republic of
Sector: Financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding
Summary: Claims arising out of claimants' alleged investment in Macedonia's finance sector through trust banking operations.
Decisions: Pending

Full case title: The PV Investors v. Spain
Home State of investor: Denmark; Germany; Ireland; Luxembourg; Netherlands; United Kingdom
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of a series of energy reforms undertaken by the Government affecting the renewables sector, including a 7 per cent tax on power generators’ revenues and a reduction in subsidies for renewable energy producers.
Decisions: Decision on Bifurcation dated March 2013

Full case title: Shell Brands International AG and Shell Nicaragua S.A. v. Nicaragua (ICSID Case No. ARB/06/14)
Sector: Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products
Summary: Claims arising out of Nicaragua's alleged seizure of trademarks of the investors after a local court issued a USD 489 million judgment against Shell Oil in a class action suit by former banana workers, which had alleged damages arising from a myriad of health effects linked to banana pesticides supposedly supplied by Shell Oil.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance issued by the Secretary-General dated 12 March 2007, pursuant to ICSID Arbitration Rule 44

Full case title: Itera International Energy LLC and Itera Group NV v. Georgia (ICSID Case No. ARB/09/22) (II)
Sector: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged restructuring of significant gas debts owed by Georgian state-owned entities to Itera and actions subsequently taken by Georgia that rendered the claimants’ investments valueless, including the bankruptcy proceedings of a chemical fertilizer plant in the city of Rustavi in which Itera had acquired a majority shareholding.
Decisions: Order taking note of the discontinuance of the proceeding issued by the Secretary-General dated 19 November 2010, pursuant to Arbitration Rule 43(1)

Full case title: The Williams Companies, International Holdings B.V., WilPro Energy Services (El Furrial) Limited and WilPro Energy Services (Pigap II) Limited v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/11/10)
Sector: Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas; Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's termination of claimants' long term agreements entered into with the national oil company PDVSA for gas compression and injection and gas supply in Venezuela, followed by the seizure of their assets under a nationalisation decree and the alleged failure to comply with payment obligations for services rendered before the companies' nationalisation.
Decisions: Not applicable

Full case title: Fábrica de Vidrios Los Andes, C.A. and Owens-Illinois de Venezuela, C.A. v. Venezuela (ICSID Case No. ARB/12/21)
Sector: Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products
Summary: Claims arising out of the alleged expropriation of two glass manufacturing companies in which the claimants had invested.
Decisions: Pending

Full case title: Millicom International Operations B.V. and Sentel GSM S.A. v. Senegal (ICSID Case No. ARB/08/20)
Sector: Telecommunications
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's issuance of a decree revoking a 20-year telecommunications license that had been granted to Milicom's local subsidiary Sentel by a previous administration.
Decisions: Decision on Jurisdiction of the Arbitral Tribunal dated 16 July 2010;Award embodying the parties' settlement agreement dated 27 November 2012

Full case title: Novera AD, Novera Properties B.V. and Novera Properties N.V. v. Bulgaria (ICSID Case No. ARB/12/16)
Sector: Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery
Summary: Claims arising out of the Government's early termination of a 15-year concession to provide waste collection, street cleaning and snow-clearing services in Sofia, Bulgaria, due to alleged health and safety concerns.
Decisions: Pending
